decks.notes: The core strategy of this deck revolves around a fast-paced, aggressive playstyle utilizing the two partner commanders, Ludevic and Kraum. With a focus on tempo and control, the deck aims to keep opponents on the back foot while applying constant pressure through a combination of efficient counterspells, removal spells, and aggressive creatures. By leveraging the card advantage generated by Ludevic's ability and the draw power of Kraum, the deck can disrupt opponents' game plans while maintaining a steady flow of threats. With a versatile suite of spells and a strong mana base, the deck is well-equipped to adapt to various matchups and outmaneuver opponents in one-on-one battles.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through resource denial and disruption, using Daretti, Scrap Savant as the commander. The deck includes a variety of artifact cards that can be manipulated and sacrificed to generate value, such as Goblin Welder and Myr Battlesphere. It also features powerful board wipes like Jokulhaups and Decree of Annihilation to reset the battlefield and slow down opponents. Additionally, there are cards like Blood Moon and Wasteland to disrupt mana bases and hinder opponents' strategies. Overall, the deck aims to stall the game with control elements while generating value from sacrificing artifacts, ultimately leading to victory through attrition and resource management.

This deck revolves around ramping quickly to play big threats while disrupting your opponent's game plan with control elements. By utilizing Azusa's ability to play additional lands each turn, you can quickly get ahead on mana and start casting powerful spells ahead of schedule. The deck contains a mix of powerful creatures and spells that can handle a variety of situations, from board wipes like All Is Dust to land destruction with cards like Wasteland. The key strategy is to establish a strong board presence while denying your opponent resources, ultimately overwhelming them with powerful threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger or Emrakul, the Promised End.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using a variety of mana dorks and lands, along with cards like Exploration and Crucible of Worlds to maximize land drops. The deck aims to accelerate into its powerful threats like Titania, Protector of Argoth and Primeval Titan, creating a board presence that can overwhelm opponents. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Glacial Chasm to protect itself from opposing threats while continuing to put pressure on the opponent. This aggressive strategy is further supported by cards like Finale of Devastation and Garruk Wildspeaker to pump up creatures and push for a quick victory.

This deck is focused on aggressive gameplay, aiming to deal damage quickly and efficiently to the opponent. It includes a variety of low-cost creatures with haste and burn spells to target the opponent directly. The commander, Kari Zev, Skyship Raider, leads the charge with her ability to create a token creature that can also attack right away. The deck includes a wide range of burn spells and creature threats to apply pressure to the opponent early in the game. With a focus on speed and direct damage, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate a large number of tokens through sacrificing creatures and utilizing efficient mana ramp. Prossh, Skyraider of Kher serves as the commander and can create Kobold tokens whenever he enters the battlefield. By combining cards like Goblin Bombardment, Purphoros, God of the Forge, and Craterhoof Behemoth, the deck can deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent in a single turn. The deck also features various mana dorks and land ramp cards to ensure a quick mana base for casting multiple spells in a turn. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a large army of tokens and powerful combo interactions.

This deck focuses on using the synergy between the commanders Tymna the Weaver and Thrasios, Triton Hero to create a fast-paced and aggressive playstyle. By utilizing partner abilities and a wide variety of creatures and spells, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and overwhelm them with efficient and powerful plays. The deck includes a strong mana base to support its aggressive strategy, as well as a toolbox of creatures and spells for versatility in different game situations. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to pressure the opponent early on while maintaining card advantage and flexibility through its diverse range of cards and strategies.

The main goal of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of aggressive creatures while using Yawgmoth, Thran Physician's abilities to control the board and generate card advantage. The deck includes a mix of low-cost creatures that can be easily sacrificed for value, along with powerful finishers like Grave Titan and Gray Merchant of Asphodel. By combining removal spells, sacrifice outlets, and efficient card draw engines, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while steadily building up its own board presence. With a focus on synergy and efficiency, this deck is designed to apply pressure from the early turns and maintain momentum throughout the game.
